meanings.definition: The act of moving or facing towards the west.
meanings.sent1: During the sunset, the cowboys rode into the westings.
meanings.sent2: The hikers always enjoyed their journey when they headed towards the westings.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be explorers venturing into the mysterious westings.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams often took her on adventures through the vast westings of her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the beauty of the sun setting over the distant westings.

meanings.definition: A unit of distance used in navigation, equal to one degree of longitude at the equator.
meanings.sent1: The sailors calculated their position using the westings they had traveled.
meanings.sent2: The captain adjusted the ship's course based on the westings recorded on the map.
meanings.sent3: The pirates argued over the division of the captured westings, each wanting a fair share.
meanings.sent4: The journey felt endless as they sailed through the vast westings of the open sea.
meanings.sent5: Navigating the treacherous westings required skill and precision to reach their destination.
